candidates.title: WASI without VM internals
candidates.body:
This PR removes the dependency of VM internals inside of WASI by using `Memory` instead of `VMMemory` or `VMSharedMemory`.

This makes possible to also use WASI in some environments where the internals might be different (JavascriptCore, to put an example), and also removes the exposure of sensible internals.

Basically, it makes the API more robust

candidates.title: Use cache in runners
candidates.body:
Runners were missing cache, which caused loading times to be non-ideal when running containers.

This PR fixes it by adding a new function `with_compiler` to each of the Runners

candidates.title: Updated spin to 0.9.8
candidates.body: The 0.9.7 has been yanked

candidates.title: Fix Wait/Notify opcode, the waiters hashmap is now on the Memory itself
candidates.body:
The Wait/Notify opcodes needs a list a waiters to works. 
This list (an hashmap in fact) needs to be on a common object. It makes more sense to have the hashmap being part of the Memory object.

The `LinearMemory` memory trait has been expanded accordingly, with sensible default, that will behave as if the memory was not shared. 
The actuall hashmap in only implemented for `VMSharedMemory`

candidates.title: Revert #3715
candidates.body: This reverts the changes from #3715 because wasmerio/pirita#107 has removed the extra nesting in annotations. To pick up this change, I've bumped the `wapm-targz-to-pirita` dependency to a `0.1.x` version with the backported fix.

candidates.title: Move Package Build/Publish Logic to wasmer-registry
candidates.body:
Moves the code for building and publishing packages from wasmer.toml manifests 
from the CLI to the wasmer-registry crate to make the logic reusable.

- refactor: Move package build + publish logic to registry
- docs(cli): Fix doc comment on publish command

candidates.title: Fix annotation deserializing for the Wasi and Wcgi runners
[CI] Add RISCV in test and build
candidates.body: Added RISCV in both test and build Actions

candidates.title: Fixes post 3.2.0-beta.1 release (but needed for the crates publication)
candidates.body: Various adjustments needed to publish the crates linked with the 3.2.0-beta.1 release.

candidates.title: Fix the absolute/relative path weirdness when setting up WASI-based runner filesystems
candidates.body:
This PR introduces a bunch of hacks and workarounds so the `WasiRunner` can run Python scripts and the `WcgiRunner` can serve files from the host.

I've also introduced a `TraceFileSystem` that can be useful when debugging filesystem operations, and fixed the `#[tracing::instrument]` annotations on all our syscalls so they will actually log things like file fdescriptors (turns out `#[tracing::instrument(..., fields(fd), ...)]` won't actually log the `fd` variable).

candidates.title: Release 3.2.0-beta.1
candidates.body: [bot] Release wasmer version 3.2.0-beta.1

candidates.title: Validate Module Artifacts (CLI + WASIX ModuleCache)
candidates.body:
- wasix: Use validation when loading serialized modules
- cli: Use validation when loading module artifacts

candidates.title: Introduce a WebcVolumeFileSystem that works for any WEBC version
candidates.body:
This introduces a `virtual_fs::WebcVolumeFileSystem` which builds on top of the `webc::compat::Container` compatibility layer instead of being tied to `webc::v1`. 

The runners have also been updated to use this compatibility layer directly instead of `wasmer_wasix::runners::WapmContainer`.

This is needed to fix #3712 because the latest version of `wapm-targz-to-pirita` generates WEBC v2 files. Currently, the `wasmer_wasix::runners::WapmContainer` has [a `todo!()`](https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/blob/34dcb3f30a4026ae7b48b05a74993922e7d91903/lib/wasi/src/runners/container.rs#L36) for loading WEBC v2 files because we have no way to implement the `container_fs(&self) -> Arc<dyn FileSystem + Send + Sync>` method.

candidates.title: Master with fixes
candidates.body:
This PR aims to do a bit of cleanup of Wasmer codebase:

* [x] Fixed `sys`/`js` features in wasmer when used with dependencies
* [x] Use singlepass if available in macOS M1
* [x] Removed unused types/functions from WASIX
* [ ] Refactored WASIX to don't use VM internals
* [x] Remove dependency of Wasmer/sys from WASI
* [x] Improve JS API with new type implementing `AsJs`

candidates.body:
Renamed:


candidates.title: Update wasmparser to v0.95
candidates.body: Update wasmparser to v0.95

candidates.title: Fix for the vectored IO
candidates.body: This patch fixes a bug with vectored IO which was causing duplicate data to be written in edge cases that had multiple buffers and EAGAIN return values.

candidates.title: Overlay FileSystem
candidates.body:
This adds a `wasmer_vfs::overlay_fs::OverlayFileSystem` which allows you to "overlay" multiple `wasmer_vfs::FileSystem` implementations.

As opposed to the `wasmer_vfs::union_fs::UnionFileSystem`, which allows you to mount disjointed filesystems, the `OverlayFileSystem` has a single primary filesystem and zero or more secondary filesystems, where a items from a filesystem with higher precedence will shadow items from a lower precedence filesystem.

We want this as part of #3650.

candidates.title: Switch `wasmer_vfs::host_fs` tests over to using temp directories
candidates.body:
The unit tests in `wasmer_vfs::host_fs` currently write to the test directory. 

This PR switches them over to using a `tempfile::TempDir` because a) it's cleaner, and more importantly, b) it means `cargo watch` won't peg the CPU to 100% because running the tests updates files inside the `src/` folder, which in turn triggers a re-run of `cargo watch`, which causes the crate to be recompiled and all the tests to start again.

candidates.title: Bumped cranelift to 0.91.1 following a critical security alert
candidates.body: Bumped version of Cranelift to 0.91.1 as the 0.91.0 has a critical security alert on it.

candidates.title: Dash fixes and pthreads
candidates.body: This merge brings in support for pthreads using the WASI threads spec and fixes a number of issues with dash WASIX

candidates.title: Wasmer run-unstable
candidates.body:
This implements a second version of the `wasmer run` command to make the flow easier to follow and use WEBC runners.

In particular, it...

- Introduces a `wasmer run-unstable` sub-command which will eventually replace `wasmer run` and add a bunch of integration tests for it
- Deprecates several feature flags in the CLI (`cache`, `cache-blake3-pure`, `debug`, `wasi`, `emscripten`, `webc_runner`), making sure their functionality is always included and the flags themselves are no-ops
- Introduces a `wasmer_cli::WasmerHome` abstraction for interacting with the `$WASMER_DIR` directory and our integrating it with our caches
- Introduces an `impl<D> Filesystem for D where D: Deref<Target = impl Filesystem>` so `Box<dyn FileSystem>` and friends implement the `FileSystem` trait
- fixes a bug in `wasmer_vfs::WebcFileSystem` where you would OOM or have an infinite loop because reads would never increment the file's cursor
- Propagate environment variables and mapped directories to the WASI runner
- Wire up logging and error-handling middleware to the server started by the WCGI runner

We're calling it `wasmer run-unstable` instead of overwriting the `wasmer run` command for now until we get a chance to do more testing.

Fixes #3514.

candidates.title: deps: Remove tempdir dependency
candidates.body:
We already depend on `tempfile`, which also provides temp dir
functionality, so this removes a redundant additional dependency.

This also gets rid of a cargo-deny error due to a race condition in
remove_dir_all, which is a dependency of the removed "tempdir" crate.

Bumps the minimum tempfile version in Cargo.toml files to be
consistent.

candidates.title: Improvements to the tracing and logging in wasmer
candidates.body:
- Now using the fmt subscriber for improved formatting
- Using spans on all syscalls
- Added recorded fields on the spans instead trace and debug macros
- Adding timing on all syscall

candidates.title: Upgrade LLVM to 14.0
candidates.body:
Upgrade LLVm to 14.0

Note that LLVM 15.0 upgrade will be more impatfull (CallableValue is gone).

candidates.title: Zero memory copies on IO
candidates.body: This patch removes all the redundant memory copies in the syscalls and reduces the need for the zero padding fix - it should improve performance on syscall heavy applications.

candidates.title: add basic coredump generation
candidates.body:
This change adds a basic coredump generation after a WebAssembly trap was entered. The coredump includes rudimentary stack / process debugging information.

A new CLI argument is added to enable coredump generation:

```
wasmer --coredump-on-trap=/path/to/coredump/file module.wasm
```

Refs https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/issues/3578

candidates.title: Added conveniance function FunctionEnvMut::data_and_store_mut
candidates.body:
This allows to borrows mutable ref of both staore and data env from a FunctionEnvMut, making the writting of complex function s easier.

Should address #3592

candidates.title: Move the `wcgi-runner` into Wasmer
candidates.body:
As discussed previously, we're moving the `wcgi-runner` crate into the `wasmerio/wasmer` repo so it can be integrated into the `wasmer` CLI.

Fixes #3600.

candidates.title: Wasix multithreading fix
candidates.body:
There was a thread corruption issue causes when real threads spawned a thread
multiple times. This occurred because the thread context was being reused
from previously exited threads.

Also there was a bug in the `futex_wait` callback where it was not correctly
returning the woken event

candidates.title: Update rkyv 0.7.40 and prettytable-rs to 0.10.0
candidates.body:
Update of some craye dependancies:

rkyv to 0.7.40 (but this doesn't fix #3576 )
prettytable-rs to 0.10.0 (github security warning about the old version used, moderate severity)

candidates.title: fix: experimental io
candidates.body:
<!-- 
Prior to submitting a PR, review the CONTRIBUTING.md document for recommendations on how to test:
https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests

-->

# Description
<!-- 
Provide details regarding the change including motivation,
links to related issues, and the context of the PR.
-->

Multiple fixes to experimental IO devices:
* enabled `experimental-io-devices` feature in makefile;
* bumped `minifb` crate to the latest version;
* updated `experimental-io-devices` crate to actually compile and work - fs calls were out of date;
* fixed subtle bug in framebuffer `resize` function, where both width and height were set to width;
* reworked input handling: before this PR, pressing and holding key was emitting `KEY_PRESS` and `KEY_RELEASE` on the same frame; now, it functions as expected: on key press `KEY_PRESS` event is written to the buffer, on key release `KEY_RELEASE` is written.

Tested on my small attempt to run Doom on wasmer ([https://github.com/kotborealis/doomer](https://github.com/kotborealis/doomer)).

p.s. Maybe I should consider splitting this into multiple PR's?

candidates.title: Wasix major fixes and tweaks
candidates.body:
- Removed generation_arena which was causing some serious leakages of files and sockets
- Added OsError for NetworkErrors so that "Too Many Open Files" is properly passed
- Local networking will now cap at 10 sockets in the backlog
- Added the missing shutdown error code
- Removed the inodes lock around most of the WASI syscalls
- Fixed some race conditions in the event notifications for WASI
- The polling loop will now only notify a closed socket once
- Event notifications now uses Wakers rather than MPSC
- Some socket errors now return the right codes which prevents panics in WASM
- Fixed a bug where the file read and write guards might release the file before the lock
- The inode seed is now much safer preventing overlaps
- The fd seed is now much safer preventing overlaps
- Closing files is now implicit rather than explicit reducing possibliities for error
- Forking of file descriptors is now much simplier
- Polling events will now be returned in random order to prevent some race conditions
- Removed a number of memory allocations which were wasting memory and performance
- Sockets now only copy the send and recv data once rather than multiple times
